intro: Xylopia galokothamna, commonly known as the African star anise, is a shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves and showy, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, star-shaped fruits that are often used in traditional medicine for their aromatic properties. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts within its native habitat.
